p: Pyrrolidine (300 g, 355 mL, 4.25 mol) and p-toluenesulfonic acid·H 2O (3.23 g, 0.017 mol) is added to a solution of N,N-4-oxocyclohexyl-n-propylamine (133 g, 0.86 mol) in diisopropylether (1.3 L). The reaction mixture is stirred at 40°C for 2 hours. Then anhydrous MgSO 4 (400 g) is added and stirred for an additional 10 hours.
